content: In an Excel sheet, I have a column containing weights in kilograms. I need to convert these weights to grams for further calculations. For example, in cell A2, I have the value "3". What formula can I use in cell B2 to convert 3 kg to grams?

To convert kilograms to grams in Excel, you simply need to multiply the kilogram value by 1,000, since 1 kilogram is equal to 1,000 grams. 

In your specific case, if the weight in kilograms is in cell A2, you can use the following formula in cell B2:

```
=A2 * 1000
```

This formula will take the value in cell A2 (which is 3 in your example), multiply it by 1,000, and display the result in grams in cell B2. So, if A2 is 3, B2 will display 3,000.
